snippet: With pro-union advocates losing ground in polls, a British official said there would be a plan for greater political and fiscal autonomy if Scots vote “no” on Sept. 18.
abstract: British government will offer plan for greater political and fiscal autonomy for Scotland if it votes to remain within the United Kingdom in upcoming referendum; proposal comes as polls show momentum shifting toward independence in vote that could bring an end to 307-year union between Scotland and England.
lead_paragraph: With pro-union advocates losing ground in polls, a British official said there would be a plan for greater political and fiscal autonomy if Scots vote “no” on Sept. 18.

headline.main: Britain Pledges More Self-Rule for Scots if They Reject Scottish Independence
headline.print_headline: As Polls Tighten, Britain Promises Scots More Self-Rule if They Reject Independence
